item.title: [Paper Accepted]One Paper is Accepted by NeurIPS 2023!
item.description: Abstract Compositionality facilitates the comprehension of novel objects using acquired concepts and the maintenance of a knowledge pool. This is particularly crucial for continual learners to prevent catastrophic forgetting and enable compositionally forward transfer of knowledge. However, the existing state-of-the-art benchmarks inadequately evaluate the capability of compositional generalization, leaving an intriguing question unanswered. To comprehensively assess this capability, we introduce two vision benchmarks, namely Compositional GQA (CGQA) and Compositional OBJects365 (COBJ), along with a novel evaluation framework called Compositional Few-Shot Testing (CFST).

item.title: CV
item.description: Mingchen Jiang Email: jiangmingchen0129 [at] gmail [dot] com Research Interest: Machine Learning, Transfer Learning, Large Language Model Education Background City University of Hong Kong 08/2022 - 10/2023 Master of Science Major: Multimedia Information Technology Main Courses: Image Processing, Computer Vision, Complex Network, Data Mining, Cyber Security, Mobile APP Design GPA: 3.5/4.3 Dissertation: Domain Generalization in Image Classification (Supervisor: Haoliang Li Co-supervisor: Xiangyu Zhao) Northeastern University, China 08/2018 - 06/2022

Weiduo Liao, Ying Wei*, Mingchen Jiang, Qingfu Zhang*, Hisao Ishibuchi*. Does Continual Learning Meet Compositionality? New Benchmarks and An Evaluation Framework. In NeurIPS 2023 Track Datasets and Benchmarks. Mingchen Jiang, Chunyu CAO, Jingyi Si, Dai Wang, Xingzhe Shi. Classification Method of EEG Based on Convolutional Neural Network. In China Computer & Communication. 2021 (22)

item.title: Markdown Syntax Guide
item.description: This article offers a sample of basic Markdown syntax that can be used in Hugo content files, also it shows whether basic HTML elements are decorated with CSS in a Hugo theme.

item.title: Rich Content
item.description: Hugo ships with several Built-in Shortcodes for rich content, along with a Privacy Config and a set of Simple Shortcodes that enable static and no-JS versions of various social media embeds.

item.title: Math Typesetting
item.description: Mathematical notation in a Hugo project can be enabled by using third party JavaScript libraries.

item.title: Emoji Support
item.description: Emoji can be enabled in a Hugo project in a number of ways.
